embeds.title: Xanatos' Icy Charm
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / The Hexaghost / Downfall

Gain :energy_hexa: at the start of your turn. Start each combat with 1 less **Intensity** :p_intensity:, and receive no **Intensity** :p_intensity: from the Inferno Ghostflame.
*-# I feel... cold.*

messages.content: i feel like this is just a "dont take during a wheel run" relic
its hard to compare this to a basegame boss relic, since none of them are as binary as this one (kite gets closest i think)
remember when this was "soulburn takes 4 turns to detonate"?
dont take on 2 archetypes --> dont take on 1 archetype isnt that much of an improvement
well its less of a "you cant take it" and more of a "youre closer to happy flower than coffee dripper in terms of energy relic value"
topical relic for today if one of my friends is to be believed
also <infernal form> moment!

embeds.title: Infernal Form
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 3 :energy_hexa: / The Hexaghost / Downfall

 (Gain 2 **Intensity** :p_intensity:.)
At the start of your turn, gain 2 **Intensity** :p_intensity:.

messages.content: okay I looked it up it is in fact topical for  today
who is that friend
irl person
so rate this relic on a scale of 1-10 strengthwise and 1-10 concept/enjoyabilitywise
I do think you lose quite a lot on boss fights with this, but wheel decks CAN use this if they have the right powers.
<empowered flame> just adds 24 damage to all future infernos and 8 damage to all searing ghostflames

messages.content: this is like the opposite problem to slimeboss
in terms of focus-replacement balance
I  will take xanatos' icy charm if I have infernal form just to enable playing infernal form

I think with hexaghost having baked in intensity via the inferno ghostflame makes sense (both from a gameplay reward and how the actual boss works) and works out so well in favor of the character being good
i cant believe im saying but we have a character in downfall that is *drumrolllllllllllll* well off in terms of design and balance
I mean there's Auto on one side and  Snecko on the other
I still think Hexa could use some nerfing but I'm really happy with how the work payed off
I'd argue hermit and guardian also are pretty well balanced and designed.
guardian is one of the strongest characters in the pack
they have good design, but not balance
Fair, if half their rares were just nerfed numerically I think it would be fine.
Although I think gem cannon just needs a rework.
nerf guardian gear too, and maybe defensive mode to 8 block for an overall 4 block nerf to the 2 turns
hermit guardian hexa collector are like 90% of the way to perfection

Guardian gear nerf definitely, and I think that the 10->8 block could be interesting. I think I remember someone suggesting that a while ago and people did not like the idea, but I think it would work fine.
collector needs to rework stash away so badly
and honestly total torch head overhaul
I still think that a simple way to fix stash away would be to replace X with 1/2X reserve
someone did that?
I never knew
I definitely have less experience on collector so I'll leave that conversation to others.

as for how I think of it now:
honestly 10->8 block would be fine
I think so, I could just be misremembering a champ discussion from back when defensive finisher was 10 block

Sharp Hide - Whenever you play an attack, take damage. Has Mode Shift 30 (35 on A9, 40 on A19), which reduces by unblocked damage dealt. When it reaches 0, switches to Defensive Mode. Starts in Offensive Mode.
Offensive Mode: Repeats Charging Up/Fierce Bash/Vent Steam/Whirlwind. Starts with Whirlwind when coming out of Defensive Mode.
Defensive Mode: Uses Defending... then Roll Attack then Twin Slam.

messages.content: 16 damage attack.
ok now with sear being the way it is yeah
Oh no not the hexa first campfire discussion again!
nic have you played hexa yet, it's clearly sear at this point

average "oh please im looking for the guardian boss so i can see the intents of it it does the 32 damage attack and" fan vs
average "include creature keyword. include guardian keyword. mod is slay the spire. 0 results? go fuck yourself" enjoyer
MAYBE float if you got a crazy floor 0 bonus with retract synergy
Honestly I played one run halfway through at 2 am the other day and forgot to finish it.

Losing 1 intensity does cut into your wheel damage in a noticeable way, but in everything other than boss fights, you usually won't mind not getting intensity from completing the inferno ghostflame. The bigger question is do you really want/need an energy relic on hexaghost? Are you worth taking a drawback like this that hurts one avenue towards frontload and scaling to have 4 energy? If you're pursuing seals, it's probably worth it to be able to play them more often and benefit from their scaling. If you have a lot of afterlife, you may be able to get away with staying at 3 energy. If you are really getting good value out of the wheel and have advance and lots of good ways to ignite ghostflames, then this becomes a lot less attractive. Here and now is pretty interesting with Icy Charm, giving you tons of energy, and letting you just stay on one high value ghostflame and light it several times, sort of putting both drawbacks together in a way where they negate each other somewhat. I think with some of the recent changes to afterlife, you will want to cast the cards quite a bit more often, so having the 4th energy has gone up in value for hexaghost.

It's probably worse than most of the really strong/manageable downside energy relics, but I think you would usually be slightly unhappy to take this in a lot of spots. It does mess with one of you main scaling methods and part of your baked in frontload from the wheel, which may not always be worth the tradeoff if you don't have several expensive, high impact cards to use the energy on. Infernal Form does a great job of negating the drawback, giving you tons of intensity to offset it, and being easier to cast at 4 energy, and 1-2 copies of empowered flame can also help make up for the lost intensity. You could also pair this with orange pellets to remove the negative intensity early in most fights.
